required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Inhaled GM-CSF for Respiratory Virus-Associated Severe Pneumonia
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I Study of Inhaled GM-CSF in the Treatment of Respiratory Virus-associated Severe Pneumonia

brief_summary.textblock: This study will investigate the safety and efficacy of the administration of inhaled GM-CSF to patients with respiratory virus-associated pneumonia.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Phase I, open label dose escalation study

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events of Inhaled Sargramostim in Adult Patients with Severe Respiratory Viral Pneumonia
primary_outcome.description: The occurrence of any treatment-emergent Adverse Events (AE's) or Serious Adverse Events (SAE's) will be recorded over the course of the trial.

arm_group.description: A self-controlled, open-label study to evaluate safety of Sargramostim administered by nebulization

intervention.description: The final dilution of sargramostim will occur at the bedside by a study team member. Cohort 1 will receive sargramostim 0.04 mcg/kg/dose nebulized to the inspiratory loop of the patients' mechanical ventilator circuit for 15 minutes.

The final dilution of sargramostim will occur at the bedside by a study team member. Cohort 1 will receive sargramostim 0.2 mcg/kg/dose nebulized to the inspiratory loop of the patients' mechanical ventilator circuit for 15 minutes.

The final dilution of sargramostim will occur at the bedside by a study team member. Cohort 1 will receive sargramostim 1 mcg/kg/dose nebulized to the inspiratory loop of the patients' mechanical ventilator circuit for 15 minutes.
